headline: Hyundai Motor shares rise 15% to hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
summary: Shares of Hyundai Motor rallied on Wednesday by as much ​as 14.9% to hit a record high ‌in morning trade, outperforming the benchmark KOSPI's 1.2% gain amid ‌market speculation about a potential deeper tie-up with Nvidia.  Shin Yoon-chul, an analyst at Kiwoom Securities, said Hyundai's announcement about the planned deployment in its factories ⁠of Atlas humanoid ‌robots, made at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, was insufficient to ‍fully explain the rally.  However, he said investor expectations appeared to be rising that Hyundai Motor Group's partnership with Nvidia could extend beyond a simple chip supply relationship, following  a meeting between Hyundai Motor ⁠Group Chair Euisun Chung and ​Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ​at CES.

content.title: Hyundai Motor shares rise 15% to hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
content.summary: Shares of Hyundai Motor rallied on Wednesday by as much ​as 14.9% to hit a record high ‌in morning trade, outperforming the benchmark KOSPI's 1.2% gain amid ‌market speculation about a potential deeper tie-up with Nvidia.  Shin Yoon-chul, an analyst at Kiwoom Securities, said Hyundai's announcement about the planned deployment in its factories ⁠of Atlas humanoid ‌robots, made at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas, was insufficient to ‍fully explain the rally.  However, he said investor expectations appeared to be rising that Hyundai Motor Group's partnership with Nvidia could extend beyond a simple chip supply relationship, following  a meeting between Hyundai Motor ⁠Group Chair Euisun Chung and ​Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang ​at CES.

headline: China's Hesai to Supply Lidar Sensors to Nvidia
summary: Nvidia has picked Chinese lidar maker Hesai as its laser technology partner. Its co-founder and CEO David Li says the partnership is good news for global OEMs as the platform will streamline software, hardware and data in its autonomous driving product. He spoke with Bloomberg's Annabelle Droulers from the sidelines of CES in Las Vegas.

content.title: China's Hesai to Supply Lidar Sensors to Nvidia
content.description: Nvidia has picked Chinese lidar maker Hesai as its laser technology partner. Its co-founder and CEO David Li says the partnership is good news for global OEMs as the platform will streamline software, hardware and data in its autonomous driving product. He spoke with Bloomberg's Annabelle Droulers from the sidelines of CES in Las Vegas.

headline: Lenovo unveils Nvidia AI partnership, Qira platform
summary:
STORY: :: Las Vegas, Nevada

:: January 6, 2026

:: Lenovo teams with Nvidia to speed up data center setup for AI cloud providers

:: Yang Yuanqing, Lenovo CEO

"We are launching the Lenovo AI Cloud Gigafactory with Nvidia. It works with, thank you, it works with a new Rubin platform you just announced yesterday."

:: The world's top PC maker also debuted Qira, a cross-device AI superagent for Lenovo and Motorola users

"Lenovo Qira works on your phone, PC, tablet or wearable, wherever you need AI to be. It works across platforms, from Windows to Android."

"Lenovo Qira is truly a perceptive AI. It's keenly aware of its surroundings. It interacts with you however you want to. What do you like or dislike? Lenovo Qira remembers. What do you might need next, it anticipates."

The world's largest personal computer maker, which also makes servers, made the announcement at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas while also showcasing an AI platform, concept devices and the first foldable smartphone under its Motorola brand.

Under the data center program, Lenovo said it will offer its liquid-cooled hybrid AI infrastructure alongside Nvidia's computing platforms to help AI cloud providers reduce deployment time to "weeks."

content.title: Lenovo unveils Nvidia AI partnership, Qira platform
content.summary:
STORY: :: Las Vegas, Nevada

:: January 6, 2026

:: Lenovo teams with Nvidia to speed up data center setup for AI cloud providers

:: Yang Yuanqing, Lenovo CEO

"We are launching the Lenovo AI Cloud Gigafactory with Nvidia. It works with, thank you, it works with a new Rubin platform you just announced yesterday."

:: The world's top PC maker also debuted Qira, a cross-device AI superagent for Lenovo and Motorola users

"Lenovo Qira works on your phone, PC, tablet or wearable, wherever you need AI to be. It works across platforms, from Windows to Android."

"Lenovo Qira is truly a perceptive AI. It's keenly aware of its surroundings. It interacts with you however you want to. What do you like or dislike? Lenovo Qira remembers. What do you might need next, it anticipates."

The world's largest personal computer maker, which also makes servers, made the announcement at the Consumer Electronics Show (CES) in Las Vegas while also showcasing an AI platform, concept devices and the first foldable smartphone under its Motorola brand.

Under the data center program, Lenovo said it will offer its liquid-cooled hybrid AI infrastructure alongside Nvidia's computing platforms to help AI cloud providers reduce deployment time to "weeks."

headline: Samsung Bulls Bet Record Earnings Will Extend $350 Billion Rally
summary: Its shares are beating those of SK Hynix Inc. so far in 2026, after three years of stark underperformance as the smaller rival gained favor with key customer Nvidia Corp. Now expectations of progress in AI along with huge price hikes for memory chips are driving calls that “Samsung is back.”  Samsung shares rose as much as 4% on Wednesday after Nvidia Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang highlighted a “completely unserved” market for AI data storage.

headline: Hyundai shares hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
summary:
STORY: Shares in Hyundai Motors hit a record high on Wednesday (January 7), jumping almost 15% in morning trade. 

That’s as market speculation grew about a deeper tie-up with Nvidia.

On Monday, Hyundai’s Boston Dynamics debuted its humanoid robot Atlas at the Consumer Electronics Show in Las Vegas. 

And Hyundai has announced plans to deploy these next-generation robots in its factories.

But a leading analyst said this move didn't fully explain the stock rally.

Markets noted a meeting between the South Korean automaker’s chair Euisin Chung and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang at the CES event.

One analyst said investors might believe the two companies' partnership could extend beyond a chip supply relationship. 

Which could lead to investments in Hyundai affiliates and give upside to share growth at the carmaker.

content.title: Hyundai shares hit record high amid Nvidia tie-up speculation
content.summary:

But a leading analyst said this move didn't fully explain the stock rally.

Markets noted a meeting between the South Korean automaker’s chair Euisin Chung and Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang at the CES event.

One analyst said investors might believe the two companies' partnership could extend beyond a chip supply relationship. 

Which could lead to investments in Hyundai affiliates and give upside to share growth at the carmaker.

headline: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk isn't losing any sleep over Nvidia's self-driving plans, but TSLA stock lost a key support level Tuesday.  Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement late Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

content.title: Why Elon Musk And Tesla Aren't 'Losing Sleep' Over Nvidia's Self-Driving Announcement
content.summary: Tesla CEO Elon Musk isn't losing any sleep over Nvidia's self-driving plans, but TSLA stock lost a key support level Tuesday.  Musk launched a flurry of social media posts on X following Nvidia's announcement late Monday that it was launching its own autonomous vehicle AI, and planned to test a robotaxi taxi service with unnamed partners by 2027.  At the CES conference in Las Vegas on Monday, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang announced Alpamayo, Nvidia's autonomous vehicle AI system, which will come to the U.S. in Q1 2026 available in certain Mercedes-Benz vehicles.

headline: This Week In AI Chips - AI Powers Shift In-Car Experience Through Strategic Partnerships
summary: Recent developments in the AI chip industry highlight significant advancements in in-car AI experiences, as Cerence, NVIDIA, and Microsoft deepen their collaboration. Cerence xUI, a hybrid, agentic AI platform, now leverages NVIDIA AI Enterprise and runs on Microsoft Azure, garnering strong traction with automakers worldwide. This partnership aims to meet the demand for natural, in-car experiences powered by large language models, with multiple global automakers set to deploy these solutions...

content.title: This Week In AI Chips - AI Powers Shift In-Car Experience Through Strategic Partnerships
content.summary: Recent developments in the AI chip industry highlight significant advancements in in-car AI experiences, as Cerence, NVIDIA, and Microsoft deepen their collaboration. This partnership aims to meet the demand for natural, in-car experiences powered by large language models, with multiple global automakers set to deploy these solutions...

headline: Nvidia’s (NVDA) Investment in Intel Supports Its 2026 Bull Thesis
summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the 8 best American stocks to buy and hold in 2026. headline: AI ‘Fatigue’ Leaves Investors Focused on S&P’s Other 493 Stocks
summary: A growing number of investors are now wagering that run, led by the Magnificent Seven, is about to end.  Mounting concerns about AI’s ability to deliver seismic changes on the American economy — and the fat profits that would come with them — has turned investor euphoria about the technology into agita.  “I call it ‘AI fatigue,’” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at the eponymous Yardeni Research.

content.title: AI ‘Fatigue’ Leaves Investors Focused on S&P’s Other 493 Stocks
content.summary: A growing number of investors are now wagering that run, led by the Magnificent Seven, is about to end.  Mounting concerns about AI’s ability to deliver seismic changes on the American economy — and the fat profits that would come with them — has turned investor euphoria about the technology into agita.  “I call it ‘AI fatigue,’” said Ed Yardeni, president and chief investment strategist at the eponymous Yardeni Research.
